content.label: It a passable dungeon crawler that should provide at least a few days of fun for fans of the genre. Unfortunately, like some of the other reviewers I logged in one day to find many of the things I had purchased with premium currency had disappeared. I contacted the developers via the help tab in the game but never got a reply.  Save yourself the trouble and don't bother with the premium currency.

I was doing great until I went into a dungeon where teiflings stole all of my stuff and died trying to get it back because I had no armor. Now all my equipment is all too weak for my level dungeons. Please nerd teiflings or at least be able to by better gear from the shop earlier

After over 20 hours of playing the game, the gauntlet vault was completely WIPED, including all items in it and all upgrades. Very disappointed!! All my precious items were in there!

Update: There were supposed fixes for the game to prevent recurrence, but none of my items have returned, nor have my purchased slots. It's frustrating saving up 75 gems only to lose them with everything else.

Decided to write a review since this game barely has any. 

This game is super fun...almost like diablo in the sense that you're always seeking the next best piece of gear. One huge improvement would be the inclusion of "set gear" pieces of gear that offer additional benefits when equip multiple pieces. Would give a bit more to work towards.

Gem drops are fairly common and I have yet to feel a sense of unfairness. They could have easily implemented an energy system but chose not to do so which is amazing. 

I usually don't like tile/turn based combat because each turn takes so long but this is much more fast paced...especially if you adjust game speed options in settings.

Add set bonus gear and you'll have a 5* game for sure. Thanks :)
It's fun and smooth running

title.label: I usually don't even like turn-based stuff...

content.label: But this game is a blast. It's like a roguelike dungeon crawler with mild, fast-paced turn-based elements.

title.label: Been Wanting an IOS Game Like This

content.label:
I've been looking for a great isometric RPG with a Diablo flair to it for a long time on the App Store. There's some that are great, but always feel a bit unwieldy for the touchscreen. But this game is actually really great. It controls beautifully, has a wonderful art style, tons of loot to be found, and an actual story that you follow through. 

The dungeons are really fun to explore, and navigation is made easy with an intuitive map that allows you to teleport around to wayshrines found within. Combat is turn-based, which I normally don't like, but it's made simple and quick so it keeps a good rhythm going. Plus, it's great being able to find different weapon types and equip different magic spells, so you can actually have a unique character. 

Overall, this game surprised me a lot. I highly recommend it for any RPG fan.

There are a few things keeping this from being a 5-star game. In no particular order: Leveling means nothing. There's 3 stats that only make a minuscule difference. Enemies scale, so you'll be fighting the same few types endlessly. Almost every single enemy has an incredibly annoying skill, making a pair of boots with "immune to ground hazards" and the shield spell a necessity. Combat is boring, tedious, and fairly mindless. There isn't a hint of depth, complexity, or strategy you find in any other roguelike, roguelight, or turn based game. I was hoping there would be classes and skills, but it's all so watered down. 

Loot- honestly, too much of it. It drops like candy, and every ten minutes you're switching to new gear, because it's slightly better and there's not any direction to move the character in. (See above 3 stats.) The balance is pretty bad, with it being way too easy or way too hard, usually because something suddenly has a ranged/knockback attack that's particularly strong. Magic is both overpowered and pointless with the mana system and switching from a weapon to a spell. I really want to like this game more, and it's very pretty, but there's no gameplay in this game.
These guys have made one of the best mobile games that I have ever played. Get your loot fix on!

Rogue Wizards is a very fun rpg game that mixes turn by turn and rpg.

It's fun to play even on the iPhone SE.

It's easy to get into and very fun to keep on playing.
I just started this game and so far I like it but can someone answer if you can customize the look of your character at all??
A very good game to keep you distracted.
I like the concept and I already have a fabled ring and legendary axe :)

Like every other freemium game this one has two classes or currency, one that drops frequently and one that drops very rarely.  Eventually you get to the point where upgrading the shops that sell you gear requires the premium currency.  In fact everything requires the premium currency:  gear, upgrades, etc.  Total rip off.

Absolutely fabulous! What a wonderful hidden gem of a game to stumble across. Unlike a lot of rogue like games, this one has a lot of interesting fresh ideas implemented well and with really clever graphics. Bravo!

My only gripe is I can't find the help system. I unloaded a spell from the quick access bar and now I can't put any spells back.
It keeps loading an loading and then crashes

Was hoping the combat system was more intuitive and streamlined but it became really repetitive just waiting for our hero to attack first, then enemy attacks second and just this constant back and forth that really brings the overall game experience down. Also, it's hard to tap on the right square for our hero to move cause the plain of view is angled.

title.label: If Torchlight was a mobile game

content.label:
This reminds me of Torchlight in a lot of ways, all very good ones. The loot system is satisfying, allowing you to socket gems and upgrade equipment through use. The art style is pleasing, and the randomly generated dungeons are fun. The ability to teleport around makes it a lot less tedious to clear a floor. 

I feel the description oversells some things, such as your own personal tower. This is really just a single menu screen to upgrade spells. It's still fun, just seems a bit less than advertised. That's fine though, considering that this isn't pay to win at all. The only annoying thing is having a cool down for pets. 

One thing I wish was included was some character customization, as I'm a huge fan of that. Otherwise this is a really fun game.

Enjoying the game so far

Only desire would to have doors be a lighter shade than walls (I'm a little color blind).

On an iPhone 6S with iOS 10.3.2

I've been mobile gaming since 2009 and have downloaded +200 titles.  Rogue Wizards is one of the best mobile games I've played, which isn't a port from a console.  I have lost hours to this title.

The graphics are really good as is the sound design.  But, it's the gameplay that grabs you.  Navigating a dungeon never gets old.  The combat is highly engaging.  The thrill of beating a boss, leveling up and/or finding better gear can be addicting.  There are also the finer details.

Resource management is usually the most tedious part of dungeon crawlers.  Here, Spellbind Studios made it a cinch to navigate.  You'll accumulate hundreds of items.  However, sifting through them to separate what you want/need to use from what you want to sell/trash is refreshingly easy.  All you have to do is pay attention to the color of the screen and the color of the arrows on the screen.  You can go from selling to equipping with no problem.

Every time you defeat every enemy in a level, you get a sizable exp and gem bonus.  The same happens if you open all the chests and/or disarm all the booby traps in a level.  The ability to teleport between markers, in dungeons, cuts down on backtracking.  Death sends you back to town.  However, you keep all your experience, money and whatever items you had at the time of death.

There's IAP, that isn't pushed.  The gameplay isn't affected if you decide to abstain.  After a few hours, I went out for a gem doubler to support Spellbind Studios.  They absolutely deserve it.  There are, nonetheless, a few areas that could use some fine tuning.

It would be nice to be able to customize your character, at least somewhat.  The character's appearance should accurately reflect the gear they're equipped with.  Lastly, it would add so much to this already amazing product if there were multiple classes and more than one selectable character.  

Spellbind Studios has done excellent work here and deserves praise.  To not download Rogue Wizards is to miss out on one of the best original, mobile games currently on the market.
One of the best new games

I'm very addicted to this game, it's very entertaining. I got lost playing it for hours, but I wish there was a way to improve your storage capacity. I know it just came out but I see a great future to this game with upcoming updates.

On the surface this looks like all the other throwaway games to hit the App Store - but underneath -- wow, this is not only "great for a mobile game" but a solid gaming experience that would do well on any platform. AAA work devs!!!
Charmingly simple yet enjoyably in-depth!
Don't understand this game. I thought it was gonna be a survival city build kind like the walking dead no mans land. It's not even close. It's very boring.
One of the best IOS games I have ever played! No joking I am dead serious.
One of the best game that i ever play. Good job
*Watches Video Trailer* *Video Ends* "Hey guys Sky here..."

title.label: One thing to screw it all up

content.label: Thief mobs... they will steal the gear that you've got equipped. And you gotta chase them down, kill them, and they'll drop your gear and you can put it back on. Wrong. In a single fight i lost two pieces of fable quality gear even though i chased them down and killed them. Didnt get my gear back. Bs guys, just saying.
Fun, diverse weapons and skills, and pets to take into battle. Very rogue like. Many monsters with differing strategies. Gems are plenty without iap
Love this game
Unbelievably entertaining for a free game. Well done.

There is a lot to like and sink your teeth into here.  The loot system reminds me of Torchlight 2 (which is a good thing).  Give this a shot if you're looking for a polished dungeon crawler with a surprising amount of depth and challenge.
What a surprise!  This one is really good :) Turn-based Diablo.  If you are an rare item hunter this one is for you.
Been awhile since I've seen this kind of and non-greed freemium title! This is a well crafted masterpiece of a gem!
love this game - randomly generated dungeons rule!!
I was waiting for it to come out for mobile ^_^ 5 out of 5
Worth playing. Very well made and smooth. Fun for kids and adults. Reminds me of torchfire or diablo a bit.
It's a relatively new game but it isn't too bad. Pretty entertaining to be honest. Good start.
Really enjoyed playing this game. It's always great to find a role-playing game with such neat the animations and ever changing adventure
Why it free here but 15$ on steam ???

Excellent game and one of the only free to play OR premium title that deserves any space on my phone, this is exactly what I've been looking for and satisfies my craving for satisfying loot, roguelikes, and a RPG, all at the same time

This is a totally addictive game. Perfect for all ages. Don't let the simple beginning fool you. The monsters you battle quickly grow in strength, variety and numbers as you level up. Hint: get familiar with your spells and use them! This game is one that never surprises you with inappropriate material, gory bloody scenes, or foul language. I let my grandkids try it out on my iPad. I thought I had lost my iPad forever. They LOVED it! I finally had to tell them my iPad was dead so they would stop begging to play again. There are in-app purchases. Hey the creators deserve to be paid right? They are there, but it's not one of those games where you have to spend money to win. There is no pestering friends to join so you can continue on. All I can say is enjoy!
Super fun inner wizard child has been tickled.  Yay!
